body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
I tried to use [`FakePods.GetLogs()`](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/typed/core/v1/fake#FakePods.GetLogs) in a unit test, however I get a nil pointer panic when `.Stream()` is invoked.

**What you expected to happen**:
`FakePods.GetLogs()` would return a `restclient.Request{}` that doesn't panic on any method call. Ideally, it would allow me to interact with the client in someway for testing.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
```go
package main

import (
	v1 "k8s.io/api/core/v1"
	"k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/fake"
)

func main() {
	cs := fake.NewSimpleClientset()
	req := cs.
		CoreV1().
		Pods("default").
		GetLogs("pod-name", &v1.PodLogOptions{})

	// Panics
	req.Stream()
}
```
**Anything else we need to know?**:

client-go version: https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/commit/78295b709ec6

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

title: client-go: fake.Clientset doesn't support streaming logs
